de.tschebbischeff.model

Class Orbit

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.model.Orbit

  • public class Orbit
extends java.lang.Object
    Models any orbit around a given central celestial body. All angles are stored in radians. Setters and Getters return degrees however.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Tarek

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double argumentOfPeriapsis
      The argument of periapsis of the orbit.
      private double eccentricity
      The orbits eccentricity.
      private double inclination
      The inclination of the orbit.
      private double longitudeOfAscendingNode
      The longitude of the ascending node of the orbit.
      private OrientationCache orientationCache
      Caches the last result of the calculation of the orbital orientation.
      private CelestialBody parent
      The celestial body at the center of the orbit.
      private PositionCache positionCache
      Caches the last result of the calculation of the orbital position.
      private double semiMajorAxis
      The greatest distance to the parent celestial body on the orbit.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Orbit(CelestialBody parent)
      Creates a new orbit around a given celestial body.

      Gets the argument of periapsis of this orbit.

      Gets the inclination of this orbit.

      Gets the longitude of ascending node of this orbit.

      Gets the orientation of the plane of this orbit.

      Returns a position in three dimensional space on this orbit, defined by the true anomaly.

      Gets the semi minor axis of this orbit.

      Gets the star, which is the basis of this orbit and its hierarchy.

      Sets the argument of periapsis of this orbit, which defines at which point of the orbit the distance to the parent celestial body reaches its minimum.

      Sets the eccentricity of this orbit.

      Sets the inclination, the angle between the parent celestial body's orbital plane and this orbital plane.

      Sets the longitude of ascending node of this orbit, which defines the rotational axis of the inclination.

      Sets the semi major axis of this orbit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Orbit

        public Orbit(CelestialBody parent)
        Creates a new orbit around a given celestial body.
        Parameters:
        parent - The celestial body at the center of the orbit.

    • Method Detail

      • setEccentricity

        public Orbit setEccentricity(double e)
        Sets the eccentricity of this orbit. The eccentricity defines how far from circular the orbit is.
        Parameters:
        e - The new eccentricity between 0 and 1, including 0, excluding 1. A value of 0 means the orbit is circular.
        Returns:
        This orbit for fluent method calls.

      • getEccentricity

        public double getEccentricity()
        Gets this orbits eccentricity, which is guaranteed to remain in the interval [0,1).
        Returns:
        This orbits eccentricity.

      • setSemiMajorAxis

        public Orbit setSemiMajorAxis(double a)
        Sets the semi major axis of this orbit. The semi major axis together with the eccentricity defines the shape of the elliptic orbit. The semi major axis is the greatest distance from the center of the orbit.
        Parameters:
        a - The new semi major axis for this orbit. Must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        This orbit for fluent method calls.

      • getSemiMajorAxis

        public double getSemiMajorAxis()
        Gets the semi major axis of this orbit.
        Returns:
        This orbits semi major axis.

      • getSemiMinorAxis

        public double getSemiMinorAxis()
        Gets the semi minor axis of this orbit.
        Returns:
        This orbits semi minor axis.

      • setInclination

        public Orbit setInclination(double inclination)
        Sets the inclination, the angle between the parent celestial body's orbital plane and this orbital plane.
        Parameters:
        inclination - The inclination of this orbit, degrees.
        Returns:
        This orbit for fluent method calls.

      • getInclination

        public double getInclination()
        Gets the inclination of this orbit.
        Returns:
        This orbits inclination, in degrees.

      • setLongitudeOfAscendingNode

        public Orbit setLongitudeOfAscendingNode(double longitudeOfAscendingNode)
        Sets the longitude of ascending node of this orbit, which defines the rotational axis of the inclination. Zero longitude of ascending node means, the ascending node is positioned in -Y direction. (I.e. the reference direction is (0, -1, 0) in a right-handed coordinate system)
        Parameters:
        longitudeOfAscendingNode - The longitude of ascending node of this orbit, in degrees.
        Returns:
        This orbit for fluent method calls.

      • getLongitudeOfAscendingNode

        public double getLongitudeOfAscendingNode()
        Gets the longitude of ascending node of this orbit.
        Returns:
        This orbits longitude of ascending node, in degrees.

      • setArgumentOfPeriapsis

        public Orbit setArgumentOfPeriapsis(double argumentOfPeriapsis)
        Sets the argument of periapsis of this orbit, which defines at which point of the orbit the distance to the parent celestial body reaches its minimum. An argument of zero means, that the periapsis coincides with the ascending node. (I.e. the angle is measured from the ascending node)
        Parameters:
        argumentOfPeriapsis - The argument of periapsis of this orbit, in degrees.
        Returns:
        This orbit for fluent method calls.

      • getArgumentOfPeriapsis

        public double getArgumentOfPeriapsis()
        Gets the argument of periapsis of this orbit.
        Returns:
        This orbits argument of periapsis, in degrees.

      • getOrbitalPlaneOrientation

        public Quat4d getOrbitalPlaneOrientation()
        Gets the orientation of the plane of this orbit.
        Returns:
        The orientation of this orbit's plane.

      • getOrbitalPositionByTrueAnomaly

        public Vector3d getOrbitalPositionByTrueAnomaly(double trueAnomaly)
        Returns a position in three dimensional space on this orbit, defined by the true anomaly.
        Parameters:
        trueAnomaly - The angle between the periapsis and the current position on the orbit, in degrees.
        Returns:
        The position as a three dimensional vector, corresponding to that angle.

      • getSystemStar

        public CelestialBody getSystemStar()
        Gets the star, which is the basis of this orbit and its hierarchy.
        Returns:
        The star at the center of the orbital hieararchy.

      • getParentBody

        public CelestialBody getParentBody()
        Gets the celestial body at the center / focus of this orbit.
        Returns:
        The parent celestial body.
